required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 1-1-8 Wash-in for Sevoflurane Low Flow Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: 1-1-8 Wash-in for Sevoflurane Low Flow Anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators propose a new wash-in technique for sevoflurane low flow anesthesia with fresh gas flow of O2:N2O or O2:air 1:1 L/min with sevoflurane 8%.
The objective of this study is to identify time to achieve alveolar concentration of sevoflurane at 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, and 3.5%

detailed_description.textblock:
The benefits of low flow anesthesia are economic, less pollution, more heat and humidity preservation but it requires appropriate wash-in phase. The current wash-in protocols for sevoflurane are complicated and time consuming. The investigators propose a new 1-1-8 sevoflurane wash-in protocol which is more simple and predictable.
The objective of this study is to identify time to achieve alveolar concentration of sevoflurane at 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, and 3.5% with 1-1-8 wash-in protocol.
All patients will receive iv propofol 2 mg/kg as induction agent and succinyl choline 1.5 mg/kg for intubation. Then the ventilation will be controlled to achieve end-tidal CO2 30-35 mmHg with O2:N2O or O2:air 1:1 L/min with sevoflurane 8%. Time to achieve alveolar concentration of sevoflurane at 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, and 3.5% will be recorded and analyzed. After that, the concentration of sevoflurane and anesthetic technique will be adjusted to requirement of anesthesiologist.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All participants will receive sevoflurane 8% with O2:N2O or O2:air 1:1 L/min under controlled ventilation. Time to achieve alveolar concentration of sevoflurane of 1%, 1.5%, 2%, 2.5%, 3% and 3.5% will be recorded.

primary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed until alveolar concentration of sevoflurane reaches 3.5%, as expected of 10 minutes
primary_outcome.description: Time (in second) to achieve alveolar concentration of sevoflurane 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, and 3.5%

secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed until alveolar concentration of sevoflurane reaches 3.5%, as expected of 10 minutes]
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate (beat/min) at alveolar concentration of sevoflurane of 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3 and 3.5%

secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed until alveolar concentration of sevoflurane reaches 3.5%, as expected of 10 minutes]
secondary_outcome.description: Blood pressure (systolic and diastolic (mmHg)) at alveolar concentration of sevoflurane of 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3 and 3.5%

arm_group.description: Wash-in using O2:N2O or O2:air 1:1 L/min with sevoflurane 8%

intervention.description: wash-in phase during start of low flow anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA classification I-II
- age 18-65 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI > 35
- contraindicated for N2O
- â€¢ with pulmonary or cardiac disease
